article_text:
Hindi NewsLocalUttarakhandDehradunMonsoon Havoc In Uttarakhand More Than 100 Roads Closed Landslide Ganga In Rishikesh
उत्तराखंड में नदी-नाले उफान पर, भारी बारिश का अलर्ट जारी:भूस्खलन से 100 से ज्यादा सड़कें बंद, ऋषिकेश में मध्यप्रदेश की मां-बेटी गंगा में बही
देहरादून9 मिनट पहले
प्रदेश भर में भारी बारिश से हुए भूस्खलन के कारण सैकड़ो सड़के बंद है

उत्तराखंड में मानसून का कहर जारी है। भारी बारिश के कारण नदी-नाले उफान पर हैं। अलकनंदा नदी भी खतरे के निशान से ऊपर बह रही है। वहीं कई जगह भूस्खलन की वजह से यातायात बाधित है। प्रदेश भर में 124 से ज्यादा सड़कें बंद हैं। जिनको खोलने का काम जारी है।

title: Delhi-NCR Weather: दिल्ली-NCR से रूठ गया मॉनसून! जानें क्या राजधानी में होगी तेज बारिश या नहीं - Zee News
article_text:
दिल्ली में इस साल मई और जून के महीनों में सामान्य से अधिक बारिश हुई थी. इस बारिश के कारण इन दोनों महीनों में औसत तापमान भी सामान्य से कम रहा. लेकिन जुलाई में अब तक अच्छी बारिश नहीं हुई है, जिससे गर्मी और उमस बढ़ गई है.
मानसून का आगमन दिल्ली में 29 जून को हुआ था, लेकिन अब तक पूरी दिल्ली को भिगोने वाली वर्षा का इंतजार जारी है. इस स्थिति के कारण लोग अधिक गर्मी और उमस का सामना कर रहे हैं.
मंगलवार की सुबह से ही दिल्ली के ज्यादातर हिस्सों में तेज धूप दिखाई दी, जो दिन चढ़ने के साथ और भी तेज हो गई. इस दौरान न्यूनतम तापमान 27 डिग्री और अधिकतम तापमान 37 डिग्री सेल्सियस दर्ज किया गया.
मौसम विभाग का अनुमान है कि अगले चार से पांच दिनों में दिल्ली में अच्छी बारिश होने की संभावना नहीं है. इस स्थिति को देखते हुए, दिल्लीवासियों को गर्मी और उमस से राहत पाने के लिए अभी और इंतजार करना पड़ सकता है.
वहीं मौसम विभाग ने दिल्ली-एनसीआर में 14 जुलाई तक लगातार बूंदाबांदी की संभावना जताई है.

title: 9-10-11-12 July Weather: पंजाब-हरियाणा से होकर गुजर रही मानसून की ट्रफ लाइन, IMD ने राजस्थान के जिलों में दे दिया भारी बारिश का अलर्ट - Patrika News
article_text:
IMD Heavy Rain Alert: राजस्थान में एक बार फिर मानसून सक्रिय होे गया है। मौसम केन्द्र ने 10 जुलाई से पूर्वी और पश्चिमी राजस्थान में भारी बारिश का अलर्ट जारी किया है।
मौसम केन्द्र के अनुसार कम दबाव का क्षेत्र पश्चिम बंगाल के ऊपर अवस्थित है और इसके आगामी 2-3 दिनों में धीरे-धीरे बढ़ने की संभावना है। मानसून ट्रफ लाइन पंजाब-हरियाणा से होकर गुजर रही है। इसके असर से राजस्थान में मंगलवार को बारिश का दौर शुरू हुुआ। भरतपुर, कोटा, जयपुर, उदयपुर व बीकानेर संभाग में कहीं-कहीं मेघगर्जन के साथ हल्की से मध्यम बारिश हुुई।
मौसम केन्द्र के अनुसार पूर्वी राजस्थान में 10 जुलाई से जबकि पश्चिमी राजस्थान में 12 जुलाई से भारी बारिश की गतिविधियों में बढ़ोतरी होने की प्रबल संभावना है।
इसमें 10 जुलाई को कोटा, भरतपुर संभाग के जिलों में कहीं-कहीं भारी बारिश होने और 11-12 जुलाई को कोटा, भरतपुर, जयपुर, अजमेर और उदयपुर संभाग के जिलों में भारी और अतिभारी बारिश होने की संभावना है।
जोधपुर संभाग के जिलों में आगामी 3-4 दिन मौसम मुख्यत: शुष्क रहने और बीकानेर संभाग के जिलों में मध्यम बारिश होने की संभावना है।
इसी प्रकार 12 जुलाई से पश्चिम राजस्थान में भी बारिश की गतिविधियों में बढ़ोतरी होने की संभावना है।
इधर, मंगलवार को भीलवाड़ा, धौलपुर, हनुमानगढ़, दौसा, जयपुर, करौली, सवाईमाधोपुर, श्रीगंगानगर में बारिश हुई। जयपुर में शाम को शहर के कई इलाकों में बारिश हुई।

title: Over 160 Missing, 109 Dead In Texas Floods As Rescue Efforts Continue - News18
article_text:
Over 160 Missing, 109 Dead In Texas Floods As Rescue Efforts Continue
Curated By :
Abhro Banerjee
News18.com
Last Updated:
July 09, 2025, 07:35 IST
Among the dead are at least 27 young girls and counsellors who were attending a summer camp along the Guadalupe River when the floods struck during the early hours of July 4.
Impact Shorts
Big news, made easy
Follow us on:
ADVERTISEMENT
Ad
A traffic sign reading “Road may flood” lies on the ground near the Guadalupe River in Hunt, Texas, on July 8, 2025, following severe flash flooding during the July 4 holiday weekend. (AFP)

The death toll from the catastrophic flash floods in Texas has climbed to 109, with more than 160 individuals still unaccounted for, Governor Greg Abbott confirmed on Tuesday. The situation has grown increasingly dire four days after multiple counties were inundated by fast-rising waters, primarily in the middle of the night, catching many residents off guard.

Kerr County, located in Central Texas’s “Flash Flood Alley," remains the hardest hit, with at least 94 confirmed fatalities. Governor Abbott told reporters that 161 people are reported missing in Kerr County alone and that the number could rise further. “There very likely could be more added to that list," he said, noting that the figures are based on missing persons reports filed by relatives, neighbours, and friends.

RECOMMENDED STORIES
Nimisha Priya Case | Kerala Nurse Faces Execution In Yemen On July 16: Desperate Push For Pardon
UK Woman Accuses Indian-Origin Doctor Of Forcefully Using Forceps To Deliver Baby, Suspended
Donald Trump To Announce New Tariffs On Imports From Seven Countries | BRICS Summit 2025 | N18G
CBI Extradites Economic Offender Monika Kapoor From US, Ends Her 25-Year-Long Run
This handout picture courtesy of Maxar Technologies shows state highway 39 after flash flooding along the Guadalupe River in Hunt, Texas on July 8, 2025. (Photo by Satellite image ©2025 Maxar Technologies / AFP)

Among the dead are at least 27 young girls and counsellors who were attending a summer camp along the Guadalupe River when the floods struck during the early hours of July 4. Torrential waters swept through the campgrounds, devastating cabins while campers slept. As of Tuesday evening, five campers and one counsellor remain missing, along with another child unaffiliated with the camp.

ADVETISEMENT

Rescue and recovery operations have been relentless but treacherous. Ben Baker of the Texas Game Wardens said the use of helicopters, drones, and search dogs has been challenged by large debris piles, mud, and residual floodwater. “It’s extremely treacherous, time-consuming. It’s dirty work, the water is still there," he said.

A man searches for missing people by a crushed car near the Guadalupe River in Hunt, Texas, on July 8, 2025, (Photo:  AFP)
TOP VIDEOS
VIEW ALL
Torrential Rain Trigger Deadly Flash Flooding Along The Guadalupe River In Texas | Texas Flood |N18G

The National Weather Service declared a flash flood emergency in Ruidoso, New Mexico, where the Rio Ruidoso River crested more than 20 feet. Officials reported people trapped and significant home damage.

President Donald Trump is expected to visit Texas on Friday with First Lady Melania Trump. Meanwhile, questions have surfaced over the federal response and the impact of staffing shortages at the National Weather Service. Experts, including Shel Winkley from Climate Central, pointed to geography and prolonged drought as exacerbating factors in the scale of the disaster.

title: Nagaland Floods: Army and Assam Rifles to the Rescue - Brighter Kashmir
article_text:
As torrential monsoon rains continue to wreak havoc across parts of Nagaland triggering flash floods and severe water-logging in several districts, the Indian Army and Assam Rifles have stepped in as first responders, launching a large-scale flood relief and rescue operation in Dimapur. This timely effort has brought much-needed relief to distressed civilians in Vilhume and SM Colony, two of the worst-affected areas in the city.
Following an urgent appeal for assistance from the state government and local administration, the Assam Rifles and Indian Army, operating under Spear Corps, immediately mobilised flood relief columns with requisite equipment and personnel to conduct rescue operations. The deployment was carried out in close coordination with the State Disaster Response Force (SDRF), ensuring an efficient and swift evacuation of stranded residents.
In a matter of hours after receiving the request for aid to civil authorities, troops reached the inundated zones, navigating through chest-deep water, submerged streets, and collapsed pathways. Using rescue boats, life jackets, and improvised floating devices, the relief teams were able to extract dozens of families, including elderly citizens, women, children, and people with disabilities, many of whom were stranded without food or access to medical aid.
A senior officer from Spear Corps leading the operation stated: “Our teams are trained for rapid response in natural disasters. Civilian safety is our top priority, and we are working hand-in-hand with the civil administration to ensure timely evacuation and medical assistance. Every life matters.”
Medical personnel attached to the rescue columns also provided first-aid and emergency care, while dry rations and clean drinking water were distributed to those displaced by the floods. Temporary shelters have been set up in coordination with the civil authorities for evacuees.
Rising Water Levels and Looming Threat
Heavy downpours over the past 72 hours have resulted in rivers breaching their banks, localised flooding and water-logging across Dimapur and nearby districts. Authorities have issued advisories asking residents in low-lying areas to remain alert and prepare for possible evacuations.
The rescue and relief efforts are ongoing, with the Indian Army and Assam Rifles continuing to monitor vulnerable zones for any signs of further inundation or distress calls. The forces have placed additional relief columns on standby should the situation deteriorate further.
Civil-Military Cooperation Praised
Local leaders, administrative officials, and community members have widely praised the quick and effective intervention by the armed forces. “If the Army and Assam Rifles had not come in time, the situation could have turned tragic. Their discipline, professionalism, and compassion displayed by the army and Assam Rifles in these difficult times have won the hearts of the people,” said a Dimapur district official.
Videos and images of uniformed personnel carrying children to safety and assisting elderly civilians through waist-deep water have gone viral on social media, evoking a deluge of posts expressing gratitude and admiration for the armed forces.
Assam Rifles: Always First to Respond
Known as ‘Sentinels of the Northeast’, the Assam Rifles has a long-standing history of assisting civilian populations in times of natural calamities. From landslides and floods to pandemics and infrastructure crises, this force has established its undisputed credentials as a people-centric force that fulfils its mandated security responsibilities and humanitarian missions with aplomb.
The Assam Rifles has significantly complemented the Indian Army’s flood relief mission during the ongoing Nagaland floods and their close cooperation with the civil administration deserves due appreciation has once again underscored their multidimensional capabilities as well as deep connection with and genuine concern for the wellbeing of the local population.
As floodwaters continue to rise, uncertainty looms and it’s the unwavering commitment of the Indian Army and Assam Rifles and their innate ability to deliver that has provided a beacon of hope to the people of Nagaland. Their timely intervention has not only saved lives but further strengthened faith in the power of solidarity, service, and swift action characteristic of the army and Assam Rifles.
As weather forecasts predict more rainfall in the coming days, the Indian Army and Assam Rifles remain on high alert, sending the unambiguous message that the nation’s armed forces are not just protectors of borders but also equally committed to the safety and wellbeing of their fellow countrymen.

Himachal rains: Eight districts face flash flood risk, about 200 roads closed

SHIMLA/NAHAN: (Jul 8) With heavy rain pummeling several parts of Himachal Pradesh, the local meteorological department on Tuesday warned of a risk of low to moderate flash floods in parts of eight districts in the next 24 hours.

These districts are Chamba, Kangra, Mandi, Kullu, Shimla, Solan, Sirmaur and Una.

Himachal Pradesh has received 203.2 mm of rain against the normal of 152.6 mm from June 1 to July 8.

title: IMD Predicts Heavy Rainfall In 15 Odisha Districts Today - Ommcom News
article_text:
Bhubaneswar: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a yellow warning for 15 districts in Odisha, predicting heavy rainfall with thunderstorms and lightning today.

The districts including Kalahandi, Nuapada, Balangir, Boudh, Sonepur, Bargarh, Sambalpur, Jharsuguda, Deogarh, Angul, Sundargarh, Keonjhar, Mayurbhanj, Nabarangapur, and Koraput are likely to experience heavy rainfall at isolated places, accompanied by winds gusting up to 30-40 kmph.

Additionally, thunderstorms and lightning are likely to occur in coastal districts such as Balasore, Bhadrak, Jajpur, Kendrapara, Jagatsinghpur, Cuttack, and Dhenkanal.

According to the IMD, the rainfall intensity is expected to decrease from July 10-11, with only light showers predicted in some areas. However, from July 12, rainfall is expected to increase, with many places experiencing rain, although heavy rainfall is unlikely. From July 13, the rainfall is predicted to increase further, with heavy rainfall expected in some areas.

title: मंडी में बादल फटने और भूस्खलन के बाद लापता 30 लोगों की तलाश के लिए बचाव अभियान जारी - samacharnama.com
article_text:
अधिकारियों ने सोमवार को बताया कि पिछले सप्ताह मंडी जिले के थुनाग, गोहर और करसोग उपखंडों में बादल फटने, अचानक बाढ़ आने और भूस्खलन के बाद लापता हुए 30 लोगों का पता लगाने के लिए ड्रोन और खोजी कुत्तों की मदद से खोज और बचाव अभियान चलाया जा रहा है।

राष्ट्रीय और राज्य आपदा प्रतिक्रिया बल, सेना, भारत-तिब्बत सीमा पुलिस और होमगार्ड के करीब 250 जवान प्रशासन और स्थानीय लोगों के साथ मिलकर खोज और बचाव कार्य कर रहे हैं। अधिकारियों ने बताया कि इसके अलावा 20 टीमें सूचना एकत्र कर रही हैं और दुर्गम क्षेत्रों में राशन और चिकित्सा किट वितरित कर रही हैं।

अब तक प्रभावित लोगों को 1,538 राशन किट वितरित किए जा चुके हैं और 12.44 लाख रुपये की तत्काल राहत प्रदान की गई है। उन्होंने बताया कि थुनाग और जंझेली क्षेत्रों में 5-5 लाख रुपये की अतिरिक्त सहायता भेजी जा रही है।

title: Nagpur Rain Alert: Heavy Showers Flood City, Schools Shut Amid 100mm Downpour - Deccan Herald
article_text:
Mumbai: The central Indian hub of Nagpur is reeling under heavy rains with large stretches of the city and its suburbs getting inundated on Wednesday morning.
Nagpur’s District Collector Dr Vipin Itankar declared a holiday for all schools and colleges in the city for the day.
“Thunderstorm accompanied with lightning are very likely to occur at isolated places over Nagpur and Bhandara. Light to moderate rainfall is likely to occur at most places over Nagpur,” according to the Regional Meteorological Centre in Nagpur.
The Nagpur city received over 80 to 100 mm rainfall over the last 24 hours, reports reaching here said.
Several tehsils in Nagpur district also experienced very heavy to extremely heavy rainfall resulting in inundation disrupting the road traffic.
The Nagpur city and district police and administration has been put on high alert.

article_text:
A bridge collapsed in Gujarat's Vadodara recently. According to the news agency ANI, the Gambhira bridge located on the Mahisagar river collapsed in Vadodara's Padra. The bridge connects Vadodara and Anand in Gujarat. After the incident came to light, the authorities were alerted who immediately rushed to the spot. A video of the bridge collapse shows a truck hanging on the Gambhira bridge and a bike being stuck on the flyover. title: Rajasthan On High Alert as Dengue Cases Spike Amid Monsoon; Jaipur Health Officials Ramp Up Measures - MSN
article_text:
Dengue Alert In India: As the monsoon season sets in, Rajasthan is witnessing a concerning rise in dengue cases. Over the past 45 days, the state health department has reported 75 confirmed cases of the mosquito-borne disease across several districts. In response, health authorities have intensified surveillance and launched preventive measures to curb the spread. A senior health official stated that medical staff and health officers have been directed to carry out targeted control activities, including public awareness campaigns and task force meetings in high-risk districts, to contain the outbreak effectively.
Recurrence of dengue cases in Rajasthan has fluctuated in recent years, hitting the highest peak of 20,141 cases in 2021. This was followed by 12,979 corresponding cases in 2022, 13,924 cases in 2023, and 12,514 cases in 2024. Till now, in 2025, 440 cases have been reported.
In addition to the dengue cases, the health departments are also taking measures to prevent malaria cases. In the year 2022, Rajasthan reported 2,213 cases of malaria, whereas till 30th June this year, 263 malaria cases have been reported. Officials attribute this decline to awareness campaigns and community engagement. Health officials have also initiated larva identification and an audio-visual presentation for educating people about prevention. Malaria prevention drive has taken place on 1st April, which also included the removal of breeding sites, awareness and more.

title: Flash flood damages farmlands, fisheries in Longleng district - Nagaland Post
article_text:
HomeNagaland NewsFlash flood damages farmlands, fisheries in Longleng district
Flash flood damages farmlands, fisheries in Longleng district

DIMAPUR

July 9, 2025
Share
Devastating farms in Chingong and Yongnyah Village, Longleng. (DIPR)

Heavy rainfall triggered a sudden rise in the Shepe River in the early hours of July 5, caused floods that damaged farmlands and fisheries in Chingong and Yongnyah villages under Longleng district.
According to Chingong village council chairman, Lungmei M, the flood washed away mature plantations such as arecanut, coconut, litchi and apple trees, many of which were five to six years old. Fisheries in the affected areas were also damaged.
He informed that the farmlands were part of the National Mobile Monitoring System (NMMS) under the Rural Development Department and had been geotagged for its 1st and 2nd phases. The damage is likely to affect implementation of future phases. The chairman appealed to concerned authorities to assess the losses and provide compensation to the affected farmers.
The flood also damaged the economic importance road bridge, disrupting transportation for villagers and commuters. Initial estimates suggest that the total loss to farms and fisheries is around Rs. 15 lakh.

title: Eight districts face flash flood risk, about 200 roads closed - The Shillong Times
article_text:
SHIMLA, July 8: With heavy rain pummeling several parts of Himachal Pradesh, the local meteorological department on Tuesday warned of a risk of low to moderate flash floods in parts of eight districts in the next 24 hours.These districts are Chamba, Kangra, Mandi, Kullu, Shimla, Solan, Sirmaur and Una.

Himachal Pradesh has received 203.2 mm of rain against the normal of 152.6 mm from June 1 to July 8.

The meteorological department also issued a ‘yellow’ alert warning of heavy rains at isolated places in seven districts of the state till next Monday.

A total of 198 roads, including 150 in the worst-hit Mandi district, are closed while 159 transformers and 297 water supply schemes are affected in the state.Torrential rains in the Sirmaur for the past 24 hours have disrupted normal life, and Tons, Yamuna and Giri rivers are in spate. The district administration has warned people not to go close to the rivers, rivulets and Nullahas. (PTI)

title: MP Heavy Rain: मध्य प्रदेश के 35 जिलों में आज भारी बारिश का अलर्ट, गांव से लेकर शहर तक बाढ़ का कहर - Lalluram
article_text:
शब्बीर अहमद, भोपाल। मध्य प्रदेश में इन दिनों भारी बारिश का कहर देखने को मिल रहा है। गांव-गांव, शहर-शहर बाढ़ के हालात बन गए है। मौसम विभाग ने आज भी प्रदेश के 35 जिलों में अति भारी या भारी बारिश की चेतावनी जारी की है। पूर्व हिस्से जबलपुर, रीवा, शहडोल और सागर संभाग में अति भारी बारिश का अनुमान है।

इधर तेज बारिश के चलते मंडला, नरसिंहपुर, बालाघाट समेत कई जिलों में बाढ़ के हालात बन गए है। जबकि विदिशा, रायसेन, सागर, दमोह, पन्ना, सतना, रीवा, सिवनी और मंडला में अति भारी बारिश का अलर्ट मौसम विभाग की तरफ से जारी किया गया है। यहां अगले 24 घंटे में 8 इंच तक पानी गिरने की संभावना है।

वहीं भोपाल, सीहोर, गुना, अशोकनगर, शिवपुरी, ग्वालियर, भिंड, दतिया, निवाड़ी, टीकमगढ़, छतरपुर, नर्मदापुरम, बैतूल, नरसिंहपुर, छिंदवाड़ा, पांढुर्णा, जबलपुर, कटनी, डिंडौरी, अनूपपुर, उमरिया, मैहर, मऊगंज, सीधी और सिंगरौली में भी भारी बारिश का अलर्ट है। वहीं, इंदौर, उज्जैन, धार, बड़वानी, श्योपुर और हरदा समेत अन्य जिलों में यलो अलर्ट जारी किया गया है। प्रशासन ने लोगों से सतर्क रहने की अपील की है।

title: Andhra Pradesh's Power Push: Ensuring Monsoon Electricity Stability - Devdiscourse
article_text:
Andhra Pradesh Chief Secretary K Vijayanand has mandated state power utilities to maintain an unwavering electricity supply amidst the monsoon season's challenges.

In a thorough review involving APEPDCL, APSPDCL, and APTRANSCO, Vijayanand stressed the critical need for rapid response to any power disruptions to ensure public safety and service continuity.

The directive also included fast-tracking solar power initiatives under schemes such as PM-KUSUM, with significant progress already reported in application registrations and tender finalizations.

title: Deluge Alert: Schools Shut in Nagpur Amid Heavy Rains - Devdiscourse
article_text:
The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has alerted Maharashtra's Nagpur district with a red alert, forecasting heavy rains that have led to the closure of all educational institutions on Wednesday, officials reported.

Rising water levels have forced the closure of state highways in Nagpur, as overflowing drains and rivers disrupted traffic following persistent rains, stated the District Information Office.

The IMD has issued varying levels of alerts for the surrounding districts, highlighting potential thunderstorms and heavy rainfall, urging caution as the region braces for more deluge conditions.

Pakistan, July 6 -- Heavy monsoon rains have flooded many low-lying areas in Punjab, severely affecting daily life in Lahore, Islamabad, and Rawalpindi. Torrential downpours, accompanied by strong winds, left major roads submerged and rainwater entered homes, especially in low-lying neighborhoods. The ongoing weather system has caused traffic blockages and delayed public services in several cities.
In Islamabad and Rawalpindi, around 130 mm of rainfall was recorded, leading to widespread waterlogging and power outages. Multiple electricity feeders tripped, leaving parts of the twin cities without power for hours. Meanwhile, the water level in Nullah Lai at Katarian rose to 15 feet, triggering emergency alerts. Authorities deployed heavy machinery and rescue teams to prevent further damage.
Lahore also experienced intense rainfall, which flooded streets and markets, forcing shopkeepers to shut early. Residents in affected areas struggled to drain water from their homes, while sewer systems failed to cope with the downpour. Emergency services remained on high alert as more rain is expected over the next 48 hours.
Adding to the severity, monsoon rains extended to Azad Kashmir and other northern areas. The Pakistan Meteorological Department has forecast further rain in Islamabad, Punjab, and Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. Scattered showers are also expected in Murree, Galiyat, Kashmir, and parts of Balochistan today and tomorrow.
Kathmandu, July 8 -- The Meteorological Forecasting Division said that the country is likely to witness partial to generally cloudy conditions throughout Tuesday, with chances of rain in several regions.
During the day, light to moderate rainfall accompanied by thunder and lightning is expected at a few places in the hilly regions of all provinces, and at a few other isolated locations elsewhere. Heavy rainfall is likely at one or two places in Koshi, Bagmati, Gandaki, and Sudurpaschim provinces. Light to moderate snowfall or rain is also expected at a few places in the high-hill and mountainous regions.
Tonight, the weather will remain partly to generally cloudy across the country. Light to moderate rain with thunder and lightning is likely at some places in the hilly regions of Bagmati, Gandaki, and other provinces. One or two locations in Bagmati, Gandaki, Lumbini, Karnali, and Sudurpaschim provinces may experience heavy rainfall. Light to moderate snowfall or rain is likely at one or two places in high-hill and mountainous areas.
According to the Division, the monsoon trough currently lies close to its average position and monsoon winds are influencing the weather across the country.

article_text:

Rivers flowing normally amid low flood alerts

.

Our Correspondent
July 09, 2025
 facebook
 twitter
 whatsup
 linkded
 email
Indus River viewed from the Karakoram Highway. PHOTO: WIKIPEDIA
LAHORE:

The Provincial Disaster Management Authority (PDMA) Punjab on Tuesday issued a flood alert, confirming that all major rivers, hill torrents and streams in the province were currently flowing at either normal or low flood levels.

According to the latest data, there was no report of any medium or high-level flooding at any point in the province.

The update indicated that the Indus River at Tarbela and Kalabagh were experiencing low-level flooding, with a falling trend in water inflow, while Chashma was also under low flood conditions but with a rising trend.

Other major rivers, including the Jhelum, Chenab, Ravi and Sutlej, were flowing within normal parameters. Hill torrents in Rajanpur and Dera Ghazi Khan were also reported to be flowing normally, with no unusual water discharge observed.

Similarly, all major nullahs were flowing at regular levels, posing no immediate threat.

The PDMA has advised residents to remain cautious, particularly those living in low-lying and riverside areas. People have been urged to strictly follow the instructions of the PDMA Punjab and local district administrations.

In the event of an emergency, the public can contact the PDMA helpline at 1129.

Meanwhile, according to Water and Power Development Authority (WAPDA) spokesperson, at Tarbela, the Indus River was receiving an inflow of 287,700 cusecs while the outflow was recorded at 282,100 cusecs.

At Mangla, the Jhelum River was experiencing an inflow of 22,000 cusecs with an outflow of 8,000 cusecs. At Chashma Barrage, the inflow stands at 364,000 cusecs and the outflow at 345,800 cusecs.

At Head Marala on the Chenab River, the inflow has been recorded at 71,300 cusecs, while the outflow was 44,300 cusecs. In Nowshera, the Kabul River was seeing an equal inflow and outflow of 50,400 cusecs.

Reservoir levels remain stable across the three major dams. At Tarbela, the current water level was 1,521.06 feet, with a storage capacity of 4.144 million acre-feet. At Mangla, the water level stands at 1,180.90 feet, storing 3.145 million acre-feet.

article_text:
Weather Update: MP में बारिश के 2 सिस्टम सक्रिय, दिल्ली, UP में आज भारी बारिश 
By Mediawala -
July 9, 2025
117
Weather Update: MP में बारिश के 2 सिस्टम सक्रिय, दिल्ली, UP में आज भारी बारिश

दिनेश सोलंकी की खास रिपोर्ट

भारत के उत्तर में चक्राकार सिस्टम सक्रिय है जो कश्मीर, लद्दाख, हिमाचल, उत्तराखंड में तेज बारिश करेगा, वहीं यूपी के प्रयागराज, लखनऊ समेत कई इलाकों में जलमग्न की स्थिति रहेगी। यहां भारी और तेज वर्षा हो सकती है। दिल्ली में भी आज तेज बारिश होगी वहीं राजस्थान के उत्तर पूर्व में वर्षा की संभावना है।

मध्य प्रदेश में मानसून के दो सिस्टम सक्रिय हैं। उसे उत्तर और उत्तर -पूर्व दिशा से मानसून का प्रभाव है। आज दिन में ग्वालियर बेल्ट और पश्चिम इलाकों में तेज वर्षा की संभावना है। दूसरा, पूर्व दिशा से प्रदेश के पूर्वी और निचले हिस्से में दोपहर बाद बारिश की संभावना है।

बंगाल, उड़ीसा, मध्य छत्तीसगढ़ और पूर्वी पश्चिम महाराष्ट्र में भारी वर्षा हो सकती है। दक्षिण में बादलों का परस्पर दिशा में टकराहट है, तेलंगाना, कर्नाटक में हल्की से सामान्य बारिश की संभावना है।
